Complete Blood Count (CBC): Reduced hematocrit, hemoglobin, and platelet counts
Coagulation Profile (PT, aPTT): Prolonged PT and aPTT due to removal of coagulation factors
Fibrinogen: Low fibrinogen levels due to depletion during plasmapheresis
Electrolytes (Sodium, Potassium, Calcium: Imbalances, such as hypocalcemia, due to citrate anticoagulant binding calcium
Total Protein: Reduced total protein levels due to plasma removal
Albumin: Decreased albumin levels due to plasma removal
Immunoglobulins (IgG, IgA, IgM): Lowered immunoglobulin levels due to their removal during the process
LDH (Lactate Dehydrogenase): Elevated levels due to red blood cell damage during the procedure
Haptoglobin: Decreased levels due to hemolysis during plasmapheresis
Creatinine: Potential slight increases due to hemoconcentration
Bilirubin: Elevated levels due to hemolysis during the procedure
Calcium (Ionized Calcium): Decreased ionized calcium due to citrate chelation
Potassium: Hypokalemia due to shifts during the procedure
